poem:
Title: Nine Voyagers to Kalamata

Nine lives held up to legal prism,
Drifting in a sea of cynicism.
For the Mediterranean whispers, harsh and bleak,
Of a tragedy untold, no tongues to speak.

Held in sway by Kalamata's hand,
Are they but scapegoats on this land? 
Seeking refuge from a hard-bitten past,
In shackles of blame, these men are cast.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
